intro: Chaenorhinum rubrifolium subsp. formenterae, commonly known as the Formentera chaenorhinum, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive red-veined leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
